hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Stress Flipping via Liquidity Gap Test
hypothesis_content.statement: In NEUTRAL regimes with low volatility (<50% annualized), when BTC tests and fails to hold a key liquidity level (previous monthly POC ±2%) on >2x volume, AND cumulative delta flips negative for 4+ hours, immediate STRESS transition provides short-term momentum short opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low-vol neutrality masks building imbalances. Failure at high-volume nodes indicates absorption failure. Sustained negative delta shows aggressive selling overwhelming bids. These conditions often precede volatility explosions and regime changes.
entry_conditions: Price rejects ±2% of previous monthly volume POC

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime transitions to STRESS OR 6% gain on short position
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC reclaims rejection level with positive CVD

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: >33% of such rejections see price recover above POC within 48 hours without entering STRESS regime.
